content: The curr_chunk is a section header titled "SHORT TITLE." The Act is named the "Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Reauthorization Act of 2002." It involves reauthorizing the Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996, extending block grants and federal guarantees until 2007. The Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996 is being amended to extend block grants and federal guarantees until 2007. Amendments include changes to training and technical assistance, as well as the Indian Housing Loan Guarantee Fund. The Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996 is being amended to include a definition for "housing related community development," which refers to facilities, businesses, activities, or infrastructure owned and operated by tribes that aid in the construction of reservation housing. This definition excludes activities related to the Indian Gaming Regulatory Act. SEC. 4 of the Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996 is amended to include comprehensive housing and community development planning activities. Section 104 of the Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996 is amended to include provisions for utilizing income for housing related activities and adding restrictions to access or reduction. SEC. 7 amends Section 601 of the Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act to include housing-related community development activities. SEC. 8 focuses on feasibility studies to enhance housing assistance in Native communities. SEC. 8 amends Section 202 of the Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act to conduct a feasibility study for a community development demonstration project in Native communities. The Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Reauthorization Act of 2002 allows for the design, implementation, and operation of community development demonstration projects. A study must be submitted to relevant committees within a year of enactment. SEC. 9. BLACK MOLD INFESTATION STUDY. The Secretary of Housing and Urban Development must complete a study on black mold infestation in Native American housing within 180 days of this Act and submit recommendations to Congress.
